eC1nzzAoPvY78g--BDUUTg.text: The most amazing burger this side of Holland Park. The staff are cool and friendly ;) love the food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom

OBkUX9T_MpuGIgP6Nkajxg.text: Traveling in from the states and wanted something walkable from my hotel. Found good reviews for The Castle on yelp so I decided to try it. Glad I did! Very good pub food and a pint of cider. Great mix for a rainy day in London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. Buffalo mozzarella, spinach, sun dried tomatoes, and cream fraiche. Delicious!!

Q0a8zjW1ETO1DpmzqiXEow.text: Love it!....it would give it 5 stars, but the service is crap, so I cant justify it.  Great menu and really cute pub.  This will definitely be my local watering hole.  They have trivia night that I plan on going to one of these nights.

ud2iU7CeYk8lWxEt1Mzudg.text: Excellent food and great service. We're visiting from the U.S. and The Castle was near our hotel. It seemed to be a hangout for locals. Not so many tourists.

QzHwJs14a7RNBoqADr6T3Q.text: Whenever I get a chance to drink with my friend Bryn you can be sure of a few things; tall tales will be told, heads will ache the next day and a right great time will be had by all. This particular evening started out at the Olympia on Kensington high street. It was closed and I got a phone call telling me I had walked too far. Ten minutes later I was at Holland Park gate shaking hands and inviting the scathing commentary on my sense of direction. Really though, if you had a lovely park named Holland would you put up a big sign that says "Belvedere" on the gate? That's just asking for trouble. The Castle welcomed us with open arms. Well, Mike the bar man did to be exact. With plenty to choose from on tap or in a bottle, somehow we went with Peroni. What surprised me more was that I didn't want to spit it out. It would seem that you lot get a much better tasting version of the stuff than us poor Canadians do because it's like drinking dishwater here. The atmosphere was quiet and intimate. It was smaller than I was expecting and as such we hung out in front in true chav fashion. There were cat calls, disapproving looks and a homeless lady accosted me for change while rubbing my arm in the process. It was surreal but a wonderful evening. It's the kind of place that I would gladly make my home away from home if I lived close by. Courteous and attentive staff. Lively characters in attendance. Good food and you never can quiet tell who will show up to entertain you with tales from touring the world.

RaYd2cj00IPe2JQb_NVwlw.text: This pub has an interesting and mixed interior which i quite like. The beer selection is always changing and they even had a strawberry beer which i thought was yummy. Even though there was a massive fight whilst i was there, the staff dealt with it very well and it did not dampen my experience.The only down side to this pub (although i have never eaten there so i cant speak for the food) is that it does get very busy so you will struggle to find some where to sit! (no outside seating either)

Kkg9r5honxc9qikTxmmyhA.text: Really enjoyed this place while I was in town. This became my local pub for a week while I was staying in the Hilton Kensington just down the road, and I thoroughly enjoyed myself every time I was there.Food is good, reasonably priced, and surprisingly exotic for a pub, I would agree with Saskia that the selection is verging on gastropub. The best part is, they do the food well whether it's straight forward fish and chips or the more elaborate mushroom risotto (my g/f ordered this one afternoon and I was really pleasantly surprised how good it was).Beer selection is ample and right up my alley, any place that has both Pauliner and Leffe Blonde on tap is going to have a special place in my heart as those are two of my favorite beers.Atmosphere is very relaxed, couches a plenty and a late 20s, early 30s crowd that is just there to relax and enjoy themselves. Perfect neighborhood pub type of feel for me, none of the 40 something construction workers getting hammered here.Perfect place for lunch in my mind, good food, casual atmosphere and reasonably priced. I miss it already.

6H68efTovMFiSZA-XbikAQ.text: Nice looking pub, close to Holland Park station. Menu consists of safe European style dishes, mostly £8-£10. Wine choice better than usual. Would not go out of my way though, was convenient for meeting a friend.

FrBAEWJl9RGkygjbpMMnYg.text: Alex was the nicest, most welcoming server! The food was good, the ambience was pleasant.  A good local meal.

ZAB3fYYzv7TmPGroRrQOdQ.text: I recently went to The Castle while I was visiting London and had a great time. The bartender was super nice, the beer selection was great and the tunes were awesome! Also a great location in the middle of Notting Hill. Perfect place to get a beer and lunch after visiting Rough Trade Records and the Travel Bookshop.

RK81hys4p8jKtDxT8ia6HA.text: I think this is definitely one of the best pubs in this bit of town. I used to come up to Notting Hill quite a bit from Sheppard's Bush and this is a great half way house. It's small and intimate with a great looking exterior and a really well fitted and simple interior. If anything it verges on being a gastropub (risottos feature on the menu) but it's done well, the food is nice and the atmosphere is relaxed. Local people come here for a drink with friends - simple as that.They do pub quizzes (call to check the night) and serve fruit beer too so that must satisfy at least a few of your requirements for a good mid week evening out.

xloeMjMyDQiOg1ptbDTZ5A.text: There's one way to describe this place - meh. It seems to be having a serious identity crisis which makes everything feel a bit akward. There's skateboards on the walls right next to old leather sitting chairs and a very mucky fish tank. I was chided by the barmaid for my grammar which really pissed me off even though I shrugged it off with my usual charm and civility. I think she was just trying to start conversation but it was an overly-aggressive way of doing it. They had an eclectic selection of beer, including some Japanese ones on tap which was nice but of course they were out of the one I wanted. I know there's stiff competition for pubs and restaurants in Holland Park but this place was trying to hard and, as a result, was empty on an otherwise busy weekday evening.

RItq-0h8EFJABqnyR64JGQ.text: Diggin' this place.  I love a pub that incorporates all the great features of a pub--wood, character, board games, beer with a bit of class and sas--food that looked delicious, really nice wines, good tunes in the background, chandeliers, and comfy couches (I wish I had taken pics).  I will travel across town to go to this place--hopefully the evening crowd is ok.

XjX2da_Uzyw_I8Iyh_vY5w.text: Great pub. It's clean. The patrons and staff are nice. The tunes are rocking. There is leffe on tap. The food is solid. Can't go wrong with this one.

7-zkGFTB7b_lrK3qLKaSWA.text: Lovely, friendly pub with an excellent range of beers (including Doombar & Sierra Nevada) and ciders, plus above-average pub grub (though the service can be a little slow). The baroque-punk decor manages to be interesting and individualistic while still maintaining a cosy pub atmosphere. Staff are friendly, as are fellow drinkers. A great place to relax over a few pints while enjoying some decent food and company.

jcpSQwVoHrGbrnzU9eSUxQ.text: The Castle is indeed the most handy place for meeting someone close to Holland Park tube. We stopped in for a few pints before heading to a nearby thai place and settled in at the bar as none of the couches were available even on a Monday night. However, sitting at the bar gave us a chance to look around at the eclectic decor that surrounded us. The Kirin Ichiban was on tap which went down rather nicely. Staff were friendly, though they do have to be careful not to catch their hair on the gothic candelabra's on the bar, it was a near miss, thankfully! They also made a comment as we were leaving You are leaving so soon?. Aww, so sweet.

6txDLFyMVLaB2AEwHNvVFw.text: Nice looking building, but its only advantage is being close to Hollan Park tube station. Handy if you're meeting someone in the nieghbourhood, though, since they have stools along a counter that faces the road. Trying to be a bit too bar-cool, though, and ends up being a bit frenetic.

xlZgFueliNr_7ATHiJoVmA.text: You lot are mean. It's alright.

2fOcZH4IO9-3rWiYWSUFgg.text: I found the service to be average at best when I went there, we ordered our food and were then told the kitchen wasn't open (even though it was after 12.pm) so we had to wait about an hour to until our food arrived.

dOXDN7DIfRhhlo1u48xCJQ.text: It is a great little eclectic place that serves pretty good food at really good prices. The beer on tap was above what I expected and the staff was very nice and attentive. I had the lamb burger the first night and it was so good that I had it the next night too. The chips are on point, they are just the best with the bloody mary ketchup. Overall I have to say this little place is definitely worth a go, you wont be disappointed. I already told two of my friends to make sure they go there on their recent trip, and they both said it was great (We are all from Honolulu,HI).

kv7BOflCoEu7_fPwFyi9lQ.text: We were there on a Wednesday night. I had the most delicious seabass with gnocchi olives and tomatoes. The fish was perfectly cooked with crispy skin. My friend had chicken and chips which wasn't on the menu but the kitchen accommodated us. Great service all round.  Close to Holland Park station and St James House Serviced Appartments

G49f4nIgDxNHHJyN16wzqQ.text: Just spent a week in London and went to this spot three times. It's very convenient to the Holland Park Tube station and a short walk from the Hilton Kensington.Nice selection of beer and cider and we adored the local pub feel, especially after discovering a lot of pubs around London now share a single owner (with the same drink selections and food menu - so boring!).The food at The Castle is good, especially the beef reuben and the baked cheese appetizer. Also the toilets don't involve stairs, which was helpful to my arthritic knees. We'll definitely be back when we get to London again.

SlYRd696acKFfggXpr3Wzw.text: I chose here after reading decent yelp reviews so we came here for dinner on a Thursday evening after being at the beer festival. We ordered arancini balls and brisket cubes to share to begin. These were OK. For my main I ordered the chicken burger with avocado and ham. They had no ham left but they added salami. Ordered sides of sweet potato fries and truffle mac & cheese balls. Staff seemed a tad all over the place but were overall pleasant. The sweet potato fries were cold. Yes cold. They shouldn't be cold. The only reason this is not a two or less is the truffle mac & cheese balls were absolutely delightful.

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. The exterior
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. The menu
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. Chicken burger

YBvy7JakPR1immgDohdUGA.text: The castle continues to be a mighty fine drinking hole. Great atmosphere, lots of dark wood, plush seating, massive candle stick holders with dripping church pillar candles. Amazing selection of beers - I was happy to see that they had Santa Paws by Brewdog on over Christmas this year. Good prices, nice staff and a genuinely great little haunt. Great if you fancy a nice drink, and with good noise levels great venue for a catch up with friends.

WlGxX1RDOkWS4G-RcUkV5w.text: This place is a great local pub a block away from the Holland Park underground station and a short walk from the Hilton Kensington. The ambiance is warm and cozy. We ate here twice during our stay in London.  The fish pie and fish and chips were delicious. My mom also enjoyed the burger. The beer selection is decent.  The second time we visited we had to wait for a table, but we didn't have to wait long. There is space for more tables but they currently are not maximizing their space.

pexVUov-J3CKv4UJqVpZtA.text: Perhaps it was a 3 but when you have to think about it then it is fair to give a 2.The service was slow to begin with, I had a problem to get a tab open initially as the waitress did not know how to do it.  The beer selection wasn't as good as I had hoped for but it was decent enough.Where things went wrong was with the food.  Some of the dishes were fine and some were simply poor and cold.  The sweet potatoes fries were soggy and cold.  The batter on the fish likes these fries soggy and not crisp.  The only dish that was good was the crab cakes.Finally the staff, they were OK but lacked any sense of urgency.  Maybe OK for a drink but eat elsewhere in my view,

JrbvCsKzjlFoh5Qm_Yo-LA.text: We started off trying to find a place in Notting Hill to eat dinner but took a wrong turn and ended up at The Castle. We were hungry and decided to settle on it for dinner. Wow - this place ended up being exactly what we were looking for! Delicious, local, cozy, and trendy.The atmosphere is great with it's big oak bar and large couches for hanging out or grabbing a bite. There is also a dining spot around the back of the bar for larger groups. We came for a later dinner, around 8-9pm but it looked like the happy hour crowd was still hanging out and enjoying their time. Younger crowd mid 20s-30s. A casual laid back upscale vibe. The bartender was awesome! He took our order at the bar and took a moment to break away and check on us during our meals. Great guy! The food was fantastic, highly recommend their pies. Nice appetizers too, we ended up getting a meat/cheese board and it was delicious. Great beer selection.I wouldn't hesitate to come here again!

eiwANW4bkVLDsHxDuzsjNg.text: This was our last night in London and we thought a Pub would be a great place for dinner.  And we were not disappointed !  First, the waitress was outstanding,she did her best to help us find a a table and then was so warm and friendly we thought we were old friends!  She helped us order with good advice and we split fish and chips so we could also enjoy the wings,very good,and the baked cheese in a crusty bread.  Everything was very good.  Definitely everyone should try this pub! Great food!

17t_lCG6Sefq5b5a2hSVgg.text: Great little neighborhood pub with an amazing interior and ambiance - unique seating for each table, including a great little half booth in the corner that fits 2 people that we loved.We got the cheesy shepherds pie and a scotch egg. The scotch egg was fabulous, and the cheesy shepherds pie totally hit the spot - comforting and tasty.

r38OqLOqjL6FeJdBdOtfxQ.text: Close pub if your staying at the Hyatt. Great little place, at first we had no idea you had to order your items at the bar until we saw that notation on the menu. Besides that great selection of beer, menu is short and sweet and the food is excellent. Great ambiance for a pub and really enjoyed our stay. Friendly staff so that made our stay enjoyable. Please see attached pictures

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. Menu as of August 2016
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. Quinoa mushroom burger
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips

v4_5JYasvtoyIiPBGCTivw.text: We had a simple lunch of Reuben's and cider. The Reuben's were perfect served on sourdough bread with just enough sauerkraut to make it interesting. A charming pub in a charming neighborhood.

IyYIeG6iDAgNaz5cY26qOg.text: We became regulars here by the end of our week in London. Great atmosphere. Good fish and chips and Shepherds pie. Sunday roast was nice as well. Highly recommend for a pint or some grub.

ZJ0cwALuh2MElZli7gH9CA.text: We got the southern fried chicken and the classic fish and chips - standard English pub with an interesting decor and very friendly staff. The chicken was better than fried chicken I've had in the States (and I'm American, so that's hard to admit). It was crispy and delicious without being overly greasy, YUM!

Es3vdgyrEbksHB98m4Yz1w.text: Near the Holland park underground station I found this a convenient pub to stop on my way back to the hotel.  I had the traditional bangers and mash and it was excellent.The bar staff is friendly and attractive to boot.

V9YMJk7nagInpZKfANvH4w.text: Went there with wife and baby. Ordered:- sausage and mash (excellent)- quinoa salad (good, loved the seed mix)- salt and pepper squid (OK)- Mac and cheese bites (OK)Loved the baby friendly, dog friendly, laid back feel of the place. Would come back.

oi1YWdNIvDINFYvKx3pCTA.text: Was staying down the street at the Hilton and the concierge recommended the Castle as I asked for a casual place to grab a quick bite. Smallish/cozy interior with a few TVs. Ordered the fish and chips and a fried calamari starter. Calarami was tasty, well cooked, not chewy and had a nice bright vinegrette with a slaw of some type, a little salty but still good. Fish was unknown white fish, tasty but not bad at all would've preferred a crunchier crust. Nothing was greasy, chips (fries) were decent. Had my first Camden Pale Ale and it was the highlight!

GNPcp3U_J0c2fr7OvYl7Dg.text: Genuine atmosphere adds to the rating of this pub. I ordered the Southern Fried Chicken and it came out blazing hot with a very dark crust. Slightly seasoned and moist all around. Roasted Poblano peppers were well grilled with a strong pepper burst with each bite. The chips were well suited to my American tastes as they were well fried and crispy. The summer slaw was cream based and contained carrots, broccoli and spinach(I think). The slaw did not appeal to me but I'll credit that to my not being familiar with this dish.Service was excellent. Our server, Maria, provided us with a sampler of beers and we chose her favorite. Very nice pub experience.

Rc72srxYHz1mlvGRVlQ3uA.text: They had trouble with bringing the ordered food to the table and had to shift the food with other tables. Also there were mice underneath the table opposite us. Disgusting.

u9J5sgpwrAbMa4MX5Jqh2g.text: Totally worth checking out!  If you are a foodie, beer lover, or pub lover. This place is really charming with super friendly, knowledgeable staff and they make awesome food.  I was in London for three weeks staying in Notting Hill.  After a long day of seeing the city I'd come back to the place for a drink and a bite to eat.  I actually ended up here three times during my stay.  Pretty good considering the hundreds of other places I could have checked out in the area. If I was a local this would be my regular spot.  Highly recommend the fish and chips and their Veggie burger!  Fun fact, it seems they typically have you order at the bar. So if you're sitting there on a crowded evening wondering why you cant get any service, its a tip worth knowing :)

9z5l802gt9YC8J4g6Fy4-g.text: Drinks with friends while visiting London from NYC.  Nice vibe in this place and the staff was friendly.  Even though it was close to closing, they let us enjoy our alcohol in peace without pushing us to leave the establishment.
